column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Trigeminal neuralgia since 2008. This is my 4th anticonvulsant. Had good results almost immediately. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Trigeminal neuralgia - first arose 2005 and took Tegretol which worked very well & win minimal side effects (except for dry mouth)but needed to gradually titrate up to 1200 mg/day to be completely pain free (taken in 4 doses of 300 mg every 8 hrs).  After 2 1/2 years developed leukopenia so had to change to other meds
column3: but fortunately it turned out that TN was in remission.  But in spring 2013 TN flared up with a vengeance - worse pain than before
column4: constant pain 24 hrs per day (couldn't even blink my eye).  Ended up having to take 60 mg Cymbalta 2xday
column5: 100 mg Topamax 4xday
column6: and 100 mg Lamictal 2xday.  Side effects extremely dry mouth
column7: dry eyes and dry all mucous membranes; feel extremely confused with word loss
column8: loss of short term and long term memory
column9: loss of ability to think logically (bad for me as a business person)
column10: loss of creative ability (bad for me as an artist)
column11: in short unable to function - everything takes twice as long to do.  BUT the advice that I have for every body being treated here and that no MD ever told me before my recent desparate trip to the Mayo Clinic:  since you are being treated with meds that work by suppressing the Central Nervous System
column12: anything you consume that stimulates the CNS works against your meds.  So quit drinking all colas (Coke
column20: as is noted on your meds
column21: unless you want to go to sleep and perhaps never wake up again

column1: Cutting out caffeine really DOES make a difference in the effectiveness of your meds - I discovered this the hard way."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$4$This medicine worked for me for 14 years as long as I paired it with nuerontin. When I started to have trouble was when I had a large weight loss. I wanted to lose the weight because I had struggled with being overweight since childhood and decided that I didn't want to be left in the dust all the time because I was fat. So I lost 120 pounds and had asked my neurologist if I needed to change anything with the dose and he told me no. Well I ended up in the  hospital twice do to low sodium levels. I found a different neurologist that now is getting my dose correct for a different medicine and I have not had sodium problems since I was taken off the tegretol xr. I hope this is helpful to someone. Don't be afraid to get a second opinion.

column3: but it outweighs the side effects. I have to ""live"" my life. This drug definitely altered my brain; not in a positive way at all. That was more scary than a possible seizure. Just research this drug first
column4: please! JMHO:)"

column1: 73$Condition: Epileptic Seizure$10/23/2008 8:06:45 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been on Tegretol XR for almost 10 years.
